title: Bangladesh's Deadliest Executioner, TikTok Star Dies After Prison Release
content: Bangladesh's deadliest executioner died Monday a year after he was released from prison where he hanged some of the country's notorious serial killers, opposition politicians convicted of war crimes and coup plotters, police said.
summary: Bangladesh's deadliest executioner died Monday a year after he was released from prison where he hanged some of the country's notorious serial killers, opposition politicians convicted of war crimes and coup plotters, police said.

title: UN Agency Sued By Israelis Over Aiding, Abetting October 7 Hamas Attack
content: The United Nations Palestinian refugee agency was sued on Monday by dozens of Israelis who accused it of aiding and abetting the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel.
summary: The United Nations Palestinian refugee agency was sued on Monday by dozens of Israelis who accused it of aiding and abetting the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel.

title: Ukrainian President Zelensky Replaces Commander Of Joint Forces
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Monday he had appointed Brigadier-General Andriy Hnatov as commander of the Joint Forces of Ukraine's armed forces, replacing Lieutenant-General Yuri Sodol.
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Monday he had appointed Brigadier-General Andriy Hnatov as commander of the Joint Forces of Ukraine's armed forces, replacing Lieutenant-General Yuri Sodol.

title: UK Baby-Killer Lucy Letby Denies Attempted Murder, Harm At Retrial
content: Convicted UK baby killer Lucy Letby said on Monday she has never intended or tried to harm any baby in her care, when giving evidence at a retrial for attempted murder.
summary: Convicted UK baby killer Lucy Letby said on Monday she has never intended or tried to harm any baby in her care, when giving evidence at a retrial for attempted murder.

title: Senior Hamas Weapons Expert Killed During Gaza Offensive, Says Israel
content: Rajasthan Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma on Monday paid a visit to former state Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Ashok Gehlot to enquire about his well-being.
summary: Rajasthan Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma on Monday paid a visit to former state Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Ashok Gehlot to enquire about his well-being.

title: New Ketamine Pill Treats Depression Without Psychedelic Effects: Study
content: A new pill that slowly releases ketamine could treat people with severe depression without giving them the psychedelic side effects of the often-misused drug, early trial results suggested on Monday.
summary: A new pill that slowly releases ketamine could treat people with severe depression without giving them the psychedelic side effects of the often-misused drug, early trial results suggested on Monday.

title: UK Boy Receives World's First Epilepsy Device Implanted In Skull
content: The device, emitting a continuous pulse of current, aims to block or disrupt these abnormal signals.
summary: The device, emitting a continuous pulse of current, aims to block or disrupt these abnormal signals.

title: Hacker Demands $8 Million After Cyber Attack On Indonesia's Data Centre
content: A cyberattack on Indonesia's national data centre compromised hundreds of government offices and caused long delays at the capital's main airport, with the hacker demanding an $8 million ransom, officials said Monday.
summary: A cyberattack on Indonesia's national data centre compromised hundreds of government offices and caused long delays at the capital's main airport, with the hacker demanding an $8 million ransom, officials said Monday.

title: UK's Princess Anne In Hospital With 'Minor Injuries And Concussion': Palace
content: Princess Anne, sister of King Charles III, was in hospital on Monday after sustaining "minor injuries and concussion" following an incident at her country home Gatcombe Park, Buckingham Palace said.
summary: Princess Anne, sister of King Charles III, was in hospital on Monday after sustaining "minor injuries and concussion" following an incident at her country home Gatcombe Park, Buckingham Palace said.

title: Princess Anne, Sister Of King Charles III, In Hospital With Minor Injuries
content: Britain's Princess Anne, the sister of King Charles III, is in hospital after sustaining minor injuries and concussion after an incident in Bristol, Buckingham Palace said on Monday.
summary: Britain's Princess Anne, the sister of King Charles III, is in hospital after sustaining minor injuries and concussion after an incident in Bristol, Buckingham Palace said on Monday.

title: Opinion: Modi-Hasina Should Worry About China, But Not Too Much
content: The China factor, while important, should not be overstated. India-Bangladesh ties today stand on their own merit.
summary: The China factor, while important, should not be overstated. India-Bangladesh ties today stand on their own merit.

title: 18 Chinese Nationals Among 22 Killed In Fire At S Korea Battery Factory
content: Twenty-two people were killed -- including 18 Chinese nationals -- in a massive fire at a South Korean lithium battery factory, the fire department said Monday, one of the country's worst factory disasters in years.
summary: Twenty-two people were killed -- including 18 Chinese nationals -- in a massive fire at a South Korean lithium battery factory, the fire department said Monday, one of the country's worst factory disasters in years.

title: Digital Afterlife Industry Rapidly Evolving, Know How To Navigate Its Risks
content: The digital afterlife industry is rapidly evolving. Several companies promise to create virtual reconstructions of deceased individuals based on their digital footprints.
summary: The digital afterlife industry is rapidly evolving. Several companies promise to create virtual reconstructions of deceased individuals based on their digital footprints.

title: Parasites, Defaced Clothing Found In N Korea Trash Balloons, Claims S Korea
content: Parasites from human faeces and defaced Western clothing were found in the bags of garbage carried by North Korean balloons into the South, Seoul said Monday.
summary: Parasites from human faeces and defaced Western clothing were found in the bags of garbage carried by North Korean balloons into the South, Seoul said Monday.

title: French Woman Sues Company That Paid Her To Do Nothing For 20 Years
content: Ms Wassenhove has accused the company of intentionally barring her from working after she tried to get transferred to a different part of the same firm because of her disability.
summary: Ms Wassenhove has accused the company of intentionally barring her from working after she tried to get transferred to a different part of the same firm because of her disability.

title: Tamayo Perry, 'Pirates Of The Caribbean' Actor, Killed In Shark Attack

title: China Issues New Guidelines To Punish Taiwan "Separatists"
content: Democracy is not a crime and autocracy is the real "evil", Taiwan President Lai Ching-te said on Monday after China threatened to impose the death penalty in extreme cases for "diehard" Taiwan independence separatists.
summary: Democracy is not a crime and autocracy is the real "evil", Taiwan President Lai Ching-te said on Monday after China threatened to impose the death penalty in extreme cases for "diehard" Taiwan independence separatists.

title: Sweden's Youth Homes: A Hub for Gang Recruitment Amid Rising Gun Violence
content: The killer was only 14 and had lived in youth homes as a ward of the authorities since he was eight.

title: "Sold Labour's Soul": Critics Slam UK Labour Party's Shift Under Starmer
content: Sabia Akram has spent most of her life campaigning for Britain's opposition Labour Party but she will not celebrate if it wins the July 4 election, having quit over leader Keir Starmer's handling of issues around the war in Gaza and race.
summary: Sabia Akram has spent most of her life campaigning for Britain's opposition Labour Party but she will not celebrate if it wins the July 4 election, having quit over leader Keir Starmer's handling of issues around the war in Gaza and race.
